DataElement.preferredName: Absolute Count Plasma Cell Present Blood Laboratory Procedure Performed Outcome Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 2 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of absolute number of plasma cells in the blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Absolute Count Plasma Cell Present Blood Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Complete and without restriction or qualification; something that does not depends on anything else; not relative._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity._A type of white blood cell that produces antibodies._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Absolute Count Plasma Cell Present Blood Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Complete and without restriction or qualification (sometimes used informally as an intensifier).:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.:Specialized forms of antibody-producing B-LYMPHOCYTES. They synthesize and secrete immunoglobulin. They are found only in lymphoid organs and at sites of immune responses and normally do not circulate in the blood or lymph. (Rosen et al., Dictionary of Immunology, 1989, p169 & Abbas et al., Cellular and Molecular Immunology, 2d ed, p20):Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:Blood circulating throughout the body.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: Complete and without restriction or qualification; something that does not depend on anything else; not relative.
Determining the number or amount of something.
A fully mature B-Cell that produces a specific antibody.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::2:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
